page.title: 02Tourism, Framlingham Castle
page.content: There has been a castle in Framlingham since Saxon times. Many famous families have lived there, the Bigods, the Mowbrays, and the Howards- the Dukes of Norfolk. Henry 11 besieged the castle, the Duke of Norfolk married his nieces Ann Boleyn and Catherine Howard to Henry V111; Mary Tudor came here to raise an army so she could claim the throne. Mr. Slade, the custodian of the castle, told us about eighty thousand people each year visit the castle. They are of different nationalities, mainly English but American, French, Dutch, and German come in great numbers. Most people enjoy their visit but some say it is a ruin, this is partly true as only the curtain wall remains. Mr. Slade says he has felt hands on his shoulders walking the castle at night!
